input_text:
Job Title: Senior Programmer

Location: Tucson, AZ

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Engineering, Research, Science

Description:
Roche fosters diversity, equity and inclusion, representing the communities we serve. When dealing with healthcare on a global scale, diversity is an essential ingredient to success. We believe that inclusion is key to understanding people’s varied healthcare needs. Together, we embrace individuality and share a passion for exceptional care. Join Roche, where every voice matters.

The Position

Senior Programmer

A healthier future. It’s what drives us to innovate. To continuously advance science and ensure everyone has access to the healthcare they need today and for generations to come. Creating a world where we all have more time with the people we love. That’s what makes us Roche.

As the Senior Programmer, you will be a member of Clinical Development and Medial Affairs – Biometrics. As exceptional partners to patients and customers, this team delivers innovative and diverse studies that accelerate and broaden patient access to high-value diagnostic solutions.

The Opportunity

You will serve as the primary point of contact for programming related tasks for assigned study. Integrating principles of the function with process and procedures to assignments within own work areaYou will develop all extraction programs to create SAS datasets from the databases and instruments and all extraction programs to create source datasets related to the studyDeveloping analysis datasets to support the objective of the studyYou are responsible for creating data specifications to generate source and analysis datasets as per the study requirementsDeveloping tables, figures, and listings as per the template to support clinical study reports for independent validation and electronic submissions. Provides programming support to supplemental or exploratory analyses for regulatory agencies or any other ad-hoc requestsYou will develop validates and maintains global tools such as SAS macros that increase the efficiency of the programmingThis is a remote position

Who You Are

You hold a Bachelor’s Degree in a scientific disciplineYou bring 3-5 years of experience as a Senior statistical programmer using Statistical software in pharmaceutical, biotechnology, diagnostics or medical device environment


Preferred Qualifications
Master’s Degree in a scientific discipline and 5 or more years of experience as a Senior statistical programmer using SAS in pharmaceutical, biotechnology, diagnostics or medical device environment

Relocation benefits are not available for this job posting.

Who we are

At Roche, more than 100,000 people across 100 countries are pushing back the frontiers of healthcare. Working together, we’ve become one of the world’s leading research-focused healthcare groups. Our success is built on innovation, curiosity and diversity.

Roche is an equal opportunity employer and strictly prohibits unlawful discrimination based upon an individual’s race, color, religion, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity/expression, national origin/ancestry, age, mental/physical disability, medical condition, marital status, veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law.

If you have a disability and need an accommodation in relation to the online application process, please contact us by completing this form Accommodations for Applicants.

Roche is an equal opportunity employer and strictly prohibits unlawful discrimination based upon an individual's race, color, religion, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity/expression, national origin/ancestry, age, mental/physical disability, medical condition, marital status, veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law.

Experience Level (if available): Associate

output_json.title: Senior Programmer
output_json.summary: Join Roche, where every voice matters, as a Senior Programmer in Clinical Development and Medial Affairs – Biometrics.
preferred_degrees: Bachelor’s Degree in a scientific discipline
job_responsibilities: Serve as the primary point of contact for programming related tasks for assigned study.
Integrate principles of the function with process and procedures to assignments within own work area.
Develop all extraction programs to create SAS datasets from the databases and instruments.
Create source datasets related to the study.
Develop analysis datasets to support the objective of the study.
Create data specifications to generate source and analysis datasets as per the study requirements.
Develop tables, figures, and listings as per the template to support clinical study reports for independent validation and electronic submissions.
Provide programming support to supplemental or exploratory analyses for regulatory agencies or any other ad-hoc requests.
Develop validates and maintains global tools such as SAS macros that increase the efficiency of the programming.
output_json.company_information: Roche is an equal opportunity employer and strictly prohibits unlawful discrimination based upon an individual’s race, color, religion, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity/expression, national origin/ancestry, age, mental/physical disability, medical condition, marital status, veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law.
